intro: Enterospermum humblotii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant has small, alternate leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural collections.
